Posted By: Tezz (10/17/2009 4:35:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I play this with krak klan stoker and heaps of 2-3 mana creatures with haste and other abilities  
sack it for two red and play them, i then get a 2/3 with haste and first strike.  
I also use the stoker to get a heap of mana to unleash skirk fire marshal  
(I have won 5 way games with this guy) and the like!  
  
and of course the Thopter Foundry kinda breaks it, (though doesnt stop me from using that)  
  
i want to know, if you have two or more sword of the meeks in the grave yard and a 1/1 comes into play, do both come into play or do only one come into play and the other ability fizzles?
posts.html:
I play this with krak klan stoker and heaps of 2-3 mana creatures with haste and other abilities
sack it for two red and play them, i then get a 2/3 with haste and first strike.
I also use the stoker to get a heap of mana to unleash skirk fire marshal
(I have won 5 way games with this guy) and the like!

and of course the Thopter Foundry kinda breaks it, (though doesnt stop me from using that)

i want to know, if you have two or more sword of the meeks in the grave yard and a 1/1 comes into play, do both come into play or do only one come into play and the other ability fizzles?

Posted By: NinjaJeff (6/17/2010 11:06:24 PM)

posts.post_content:
Omg, it just got BANNED! Wow, that's actually really surprising, I didn't think they'd be willing to get rid of hypergenesis AND this in the same update, and cut out half of extended...then again, sword of the meek IS pretty good....ok.....broken....  
  
http://www.wizards.com/magic/magazine/article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/feature/95b  
  
Oh, and to Ava\_Adore: I really don't know, so I may be wrong, but I think that the all the ability would know is it's supposed to "return to the battlefield and attach to that creature". So as long as the creature still exists, I think (I'm not sure) that they would both return. Maybe?
